subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] how do you spell 'ire' ?
msgSnippet: Your examples should usually be spelled as simply as possible (so as to minimize the energy used and maximize the speed of writing). Fire and fear each have
messageBody:
Your examples should usually be spelled as simply as possible (so as to minimize the energy used and maximize the speed of writing). Fire and fear each have only 3 necessary sounds and thus can and should be written with the "f", one vowel sound, and the "r".
 
Which vowel sound? The one that makes the reader most readily recognize (read) the right word regardless of how the writer or the reader ordinarily pronounces it.
Fire = 9,31,25; fear= 9,27,25.
 
However, if the nature of what you are writing is such that you want the accent to be "heard" literally, then yes you should spell the word phonetically to emphasize every exact sound.
 
And, BTW letter 36 is not an "r", but the unstressed vowel sound that usually preceeds an "r". If you wrote 9,31,36, I would probably understand the right word, but I would think you were saying "FI-ah" (in my mind, mocking the Massachusetts USA accent)

peter_r_guinness <malt99@...> wrote:
I've only just started learning junior qwikscript and am uncertain how
to spell (using an RP english accent) the 'ire' compond vowel sound,
such as in the word 'fire'.
According dictionary pronunciations I've looked at 'fire' would be
spelt 'fee-I-utter' (9-31-36).  What I'm not sure of is whether to
apply the spell all r's rule in this case. ie: 'fee-I-utter-roe' (9-31-
36-25).  The only qwikscript spelling I've found is for the General
American accent - 'fee-I-roe'.

Also how about for the 'ear' sound (fear, here, etc..): eg, is 'fear'
spelt (with an RP english accent) 'fee-eat-utter' (9-27-36) or with
the apply all r's rule 'fee-eat-utter-roe' (9-27-36-25)?

Thanks

Your examples should usually be spelled as simply as possible (so as to minimize the energy used and maximize the speed of writing). Fire and fear each have only 3 necessary sounds and thus can and should be written with the "f", one vowel sound, and the "r". 
   
  Which vowel sound? The one that makes the reader most readily recognize (read) the right word regardless of how the writer or the reader ordinarily pronounces it. 
  Fire = 9,31,25; fear= 9,27,25. 
   
  However, if the nature of what you are writing is such that you want the accent to be "heard" literally, then yes you should spell the word phonetically to emphasize every exact sound. 
   
  And, BTW letter 36 is not an "r", but the unstressed vowel sound that usually preceeds an "r". If you wrote 9,31,36, I would probably understand the right word, but I would think you were saying "FI-ah" (in my mind, mocking the Massachusetts USA accent)

  I've only just started learning junior qwikscript and am uncertain how 
to spell (using an RP english accent) the 'ire' compond vowel sound,

According dictionary pronunciations I've looked at 'fire' would be

36-25).  The only qwikscript spelling I've found is for the General 
American accent - 'fee-I-roe'.

Also how about for the 'ear' sound (fear, here, etc..): eg, is 'fear' 
spelt (with an RP english accent) 'fee-eat-utter' (9-27-36) or with 
the apply all r's rule 'fee-eat-utter-roe' (9-27-36-25)?

Thanks
